title: Photostat, "Elevation of an apartment building on Rue Heine, Paris", 1925
medium: Photostat and Black ink, graphite on tracing paper
signed: Signed bottom right: Dressee par l'architecte soussigne/ Paris le 4 December 1925/ Hector Guimard
inscribed:
Inscribed in graphite on top: 3rd floor (last home of H. Guimard in Paris)
Inscribed in graphite on bottom: Accorded Grand Prix de Facade 1929
Inscribed on top in black ink: IMMEUBLE RUE H. HEINE/ FACADE SUR RUE
description: Elevation of the principal facade of a six and a half story apartment house, with a quadruple fenestrated central panel, flanked by panels of double fenestration. Base of building in larger stones that become smaller stones after the ground floor.

tombstone.epitaph:
Photostat, "Elevation of an apartment building on Rue Heine, Paris", 1925.
1925. Photostat and Black ink, graphite on tracing paper. Gift of Mme. Hector Guimard. 1950-66-29.
